103DC7B798A6449E942AA80A85872D86.description: Reflect on personal language journey and aspirations for future language learning.

00062B51CA0E449D8C26D0D50984B435.description: Participate in Canadian communities, programming and initiatives (e.g., Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst Canada) that support the use of German language.

2A7B547788BA4F84A314784B68C819F9.description: Explore careers in Canada for which the ability to speak German is a requirement or an asset (e.g., federal government, translation, education, tourism and Royal Canadian Mounted Police).

767E1546379C49D98058D1009FD74569.description: Investigate scholarship, study and travel opportunities available to German-speaking students in Canada.

813DA106C6F34027BE844995E5B59587.description: Research opportunities to further personal German language learning in Canada (e.g., postsecondary courses, online courses, exchange programs and community language learning centres).

F9F3C79F140C45FAB9B3D2F7AA85487B.description: Seek opportunities to communicate in German at the national level (e.g., German-speaking communities in Canadian social media groups, national German language newsletters and magazines, German-Canadian podcasts, videos and television, corresponding in German with students from another province or territory).

79DE245B2AED4011BD2927AF577C3311.description: Explore summer work opportunities and practicum placements in Canada for German-speaking students.

111FD21408FC44999F703905AFBFA2DD.description: Explain possible connections between language and culture.

2A7B176FF458493399A66004A348535D.description: Investigate opportunities in Canada to use and develop German language skills and explore personal identity as a German language learner.

895E999FB9EC4B748D896FD80BD13EA9.description: Recognize cultural-linguistic world view of German speakers about topics such as: education; technology; culture; and, celebrations and holidays.

95135343530F4DBF9DDAC81E4B91330F.description: Compare current and historical experiences of German-speaking newcomers to Canada.

63C80675B5C04E62AAD7373FC06A4AF1.description: Discuss historical issues (e.g., anti-German sentiment and internment camps) German communities have encountered in Canada.

0C78F8C732464D43AC7D8A545E30525C.description: Relate elements of German-speakers’ culture and heritage to other Canadian cultures and heritages.

5C753D538E8247BB87733D5642BC8920.description: Inquire about German-speaking culture and heritage (e.g., the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history and food) in Canada by: reading, listening to or viewing tourist information or facts about German-speaking Canadian communities; researching Canadian organizations, events and festivals; and, exploring German-speaking communities in Canada.

D8CAC7FDDF254E86B10AE8E7CFCACCB9.description: Explore the influence of German culture on Canadian society, including: food and drink; traditional and contemporary clothing; and, traditions, celebrations and holidays.

8C3CEE689A6445649EC1303291ABBA4B.description: Describe the lives and contributions of Canadian German-speakers (e.g., John Diefenbaker).

5E94B65C77014DB18201E224B0E3297F.description: Explore historical and contemporary elements, and the cultural and linguistic diversity, of German cultures in Canada.

61FD5778A771487F942A5639ADE69196.description: Incorporate the following in written productions: evidence of planning (e.g., project chart and timeline); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., opening sentence, order of ideas and word order); appropriate tone; context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and, linguistic conventions.

0043DBBC0AF24E3BA33A06616FF2B345.description: Employ appropriate language and vocabulary when producing formal texts (e.g., menus, surveys and news articles).

250884C8E28C40B68C7FC98B38E13598.description: Experiment with German language and vocabulary through a variety of texts (e.g., poems, short stories, songs, skits and cartoons).

E3D1559AF0944A73BDB901FFE4A2126D.description: Communicate meaning about time, in the context of making plans and schedules, with reference to the 12-hour and 24-hour clocks.

187462E27FA448FCB3808A25EB7B51C9.description: Share factual information in a formal text (e.g., newspaper articles and first-person accounts).

0E7C7A157FB44B0FBC262571E5D621A0.description: Recount personal experiences (e.g., holidays and celebrations) using a variety of narrative text types (e.g., short stories, scrapbooks and poetry).

994B3AC837664E698FDBA12957382175.description: Express opinions and perspectives on various topics (e.g., hobbies, current events and entertainment) in a personal letter.

E9AB1B0057F647A5A683A2DE577E8CB4.description: Convey personal information and emotions in paragraphs with simple sentences.

180E8B8D87F74431A438107175BC8D74.description: Produce a variety of short written German texts related to big ideas such as: German communities in Canada; festivals and holidays; and, physical health and well-being.

EFF808A975E94D1C8C50FDE7E1E91867.description: Produce, with some guidance, a variety of short written German texts on familiar topics to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

724C8E299AD6452C9AB41131FE40EED8.description: Incorporate the following in oral productions: evidence of planning (e.g., project charts and timelines); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., opening sentence, order of ideas and word order); appropriate tone; context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and, linguistic conventions.

2E6D7FA66200432E9A50E367B7983F1D.description: Employ appropriate language and vocabulary in formal presentations.

84BAF1CFB8B14CCFB5D5251650300098.description: Produce oral presentations (e.g., skits, dialogues and informational presentations) using a variety of visuals (e.g., PowerPoint, charts, maps and pictures) to support expression.

FB41EB68708444899C3870CCE839974D.description: Communicate about health and well-being: inquire into, and express care about, others’ well-being; health problems to a health professional; answer simple questions regarding personal health; and, use gestures and body language to convey the message.

619D5E2DAEB046D683B83B8CBFA195A1.description: Conduct phone calls and leave voice mail messages with common phrases such as: explaining anticipated return time; and, requesting a return phone call.

95E67ECCBE1A406989261318345CDCF6.description: Communicate time or dates with lexicalized phrases (e.g., in the summer, last week, next month and midnight).

85F91C301CC74EF8A407F77E4DD571FD.description: Provide instructions for performing a task (e.g., following a recipe and reading a map) and model procedures.

C3F7D7C03CBD467BAC7A26D207AD7733.description: Share opinions, and invite others to share theirs, on familiar topics (e.g., fashion, transportation and entertainment).

1691AE2FCF3F4D8D96730FC3030BD5D0.description: Participate in conversations to share information on predictable and familiar topics such as holidays (e.g., “Ich bin im Sommer ins Theater gegangen.”), food (e.g., “Ich finde diesen Kuchen lecker.”) and the environment (e.g., “Wir haben weite Felder in der Prärie.”).

99A0C8DB32E34C20858DF710BF76DFB8.description: Respond appropriately to other speakers when participating in guided conversations.

081ED7C250734B5AB073E6047AD25651.description: Produce a variety of short oral Spanish texts related to big ideas such as: German communities in Canada; festivals and holidays; and, physical health and well-being.

FA445A340DD646C1B1EF231C0D12981B.description: Produce, with some guidance, a variety of short oral German texts on familiar topics to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

B4ED350BEA8147608C594EBF87E80C44.description: Explore how German is used creatively for entertainment and aesthetic purposes.

FEFA2E4D144C4E3BB23533B5B7DB7D6E.description: Make connections between the message in written texts and personal life experiences.

157A2354A9F940C9AE7C686B78BDA5AA.description: Summarize the main idea and supporting details of a variety of non-fiction formal (e.g., essays, articles, formal letters and speeches) and informal (e.g., blogs, websites and magazines) written texts.

D08A00014428411AA1C5BB375162B61F.description: Paraphrase the message presented in short written texts on familiar topics (e.g., schedules, hobbies and local places).

2CDA5E0D4D984EE183FF92DF496F581F.description: Infer the intended meaning of literary devices and word play.

8EF1E7E1D3064B87B41FF88FD3BA6D10.description: Navigate German-language websites to find desired information.

52E2AD517E4B4937B8ED219E63E36B95.description: Interpret information about time, in the context of making plans and schedules, in both 12-hour and 24-hour clock formats.

A3866C620E70417CAF578B410720448A.description: Pose questions for clarification about menu options (e.g., daily specials and special orders).

49ED3561080B4E7B9987FAC57BE0314D.description: Pose questions for clarification about menu options (e.g., daily specials and special orders).

C09FB403D37147EABCCE7658E47425AF.description: Describe the main character(s), conflict and theme in simple short stories.

B3C7782D160D49DC98C33BD2D6B7BD18.description: Interpret guides and directions in a building (e.g., location of an office, elevator and washroom) and in airports (e.g., departures, arrivals and terminals).

759CB99B889F4F889BE657107822A592.description: Identify the intended purpose and audience of written texts.

14A27216E2524DBA848EE522267BA9A2.description: Read a variety of short written German texts (e.g., newspaper articles, scripts, poetry and short stories) that address big ideas such as: German communities in Canada; festivals and holidays; and, physical health and well-being.

0027928949284E0888C6AA6E21BC2B48.description: Construct meaning, with some guidance, of a variety of short written non-fiction and fiction German texts on familiar topics to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

281B56BB296E47AE8D60F85DFA6CDED2.description: Make connections between the message in oral texts and personal life experiences.

F79E671755304800A089D8D6623041E0.description: Represent comprehension of an oral text in a variety of ways (e.g., charts, graphs and concept maps).

B3E313AAC8DB4567B2F9AC1FB7E580E7.description: Summarize the main ideas of a presentation with visual aids (e.g., illustrations, diagrams and concrete examples).

9BA7902B22434CC1813E3B581440EB5C.description: Extract main points from short broadcasts (e.g., weather forecast, sports results, news bulletins and public service announcements).

9157A4CF42274CFABB0A1951AE1B07B0.description: Retrieve information related to numbers (e.g., prices, quantities and time) in familiar contexts (e.g., airports, sporting events and shopping malls).

1665A91733714E2A869B269CBDA6DAB2.description: Determine if conversation participants agree or disagree on the topic of discussion.

D3876D4CE15945C48A016B1F803102DD.description: Identify the intended purpose and audience of oral texts.

5837B1581C3D4E3E935453131B3038BA.description: Comprehend and respond to information from oral texts on familiar topics such as the environment, holidays and fashion.

EE757E488F2D446C9D1F3BE220287C1F.description: Respond appropriately to simple questions during daily conversations regarding familiar topics (e.g., transportation, festivals, food and drink).

ED5D0082D782447087F3AEEF5FB395A5.description: Listen to and view a variety of short oral German texts (e.g., news reports, music videos, spoken word poetry and films) that address big ideas such as: German communities in Canada; festivals and holidays; and, physical health and well-being.

BDFD657F53514D55AA651FC0DD870988.description: Construct meaning, with some guidance, of a variety of short oral non-fiction and fiction German texts on familiar topics to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

525CB18EA71A4398B789D1C92C903375.description: Enhance communication with the following types of prepositions: dative prepositions (e.g., aus, bei, mit, nach, von, seit, zu), followed by the appropriate adjective endings and/or pronouns (e.g., “Samuel geht gern mit seinem neuen Freund ins Kino”); and, accusative prepositions (e.g., durch, für, gegen, ohne, um), followed by the appropriate adjective endings and/or pronouns (e.g., “Sanjida geht durch die offene Tür in den Flur”).

69744CD5421A4407A04115C69FC011EA.description: Practise using the following types of pronouns to clarify communication: relative pronouns to supply additional information (e.g., “Ich trage meine neue Hose, die ich in den tollen Laden gestern gekauft habe.“); and, dative pronouns such as “mir”, “dir”, “ihm” and “ihr” when using dative verbs such as “gehören”, “gefallen”, “passen”, “stehen”, “helfen” (e.g., “Deine neuen Schuhe gefallen mir sehr.”).

93F481BEBD7D4EF187BC091A4CD54161.description: Apply adjective endings in the accusative and dative case, using both strong and weak ending patterns and definite and indefinite articles (e.g., “Ich trage ein weißes Hemd mit meinem blauen Rock.”).

F20D7BEF9D804AA38C8753C50F609096.description: Use conjunctions such as “weil”, “damit”, “dass”, “als”, and “wenn” to add subordinate clauses (e.g., “Wenn die Kekse braun sind, nimm sie aus dem Ofen.”).

F8BBC4D9960F4379805E86FF91F2F950.description: Compose sentences using “two way” adjectives (e.g., “Ich gehe in die Klasse.”, “Ich gehe zu der Tafel in der Klasse.”).

1C831734DC554DE68AD7E6A557F591B0.description: Produce sentences using the following verb conventions: present tense; modal verbs in the past perfect tense (e.g., “Ich kann im Winter Eislaufen gehen.”, “Ich bin im Winter Eislaufen gegangen.”); and, auxiliary verb in the past perfect tense.

766F3F6F5220429EA1471FFD34CBC309.description: Apply conventional word order for sentences with: one verb; two verbs (e.g., “Ich möchte gern eine Pizza bestellen.”); relative clauses (e.g., “Ich bringe dir ein Buch, damit du lesen kannst.”); relative pronouns (eg.”Ich bringe dir ein Buch, das dir bestimmt gefällt.”); and, conjunctions.

C08FA346C5D44BC180A76F0694580A3D.description: Use basic context-appropriate vocabulary and familiar German idioms in producing written and oral texts.

AE363BC1E4B64B928C6B416A9E8CCB96.description: Apply conventional spelling and capitalization consistently in written text.

2D41F3F90CB34FB5921337B717EF8327.description: Demonstrate, when producing oral and written texts, knowledge of German language concepts including context-specific vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

7BA72E6B40914CE5934915C606F7B0E8.description: Interpret German gestures and common idiomatic expressions.

2960F870030F4667963BE307ABF2868E.description: Explore German language conventions, including: similarities and differences of past tense use in English and German; the role of conjunctions; the role of relative pronouns (i.e., in particular that relative pronouns reflect the gender and role of the noun in the sentence (e.g., “Ich sehe ihn.”); differences in word order according to the number of verbs in a sentence, and when using relative clauses; different elements in compound nouns; and, relational phrases when conjunctions and subordinate clauses are used.

CCC6F6F62CD04B7BA581784C30826504.description: Analyze personal and formal registers (e.g., talking with “du” [casual] and “Sie” [formal]) in oral presentations.

8D124F0DDCBE410F8D3D76576DB82720.description: Investigate irregular verb conjugation patterns in the present, past perfect and imperfect tenses.

357A0D2B93A3403FB5AA3B57A04B6476.description: Recognize dative verbs (e.g., passen, stehen, gefallen and gehören).

22EC3429E5E64ABCA0D01477FA86A4A8.description: Decode individual words and sounds heard in multisyllabic words.

8BC73813E1E24B079CB535FA39CA9106.description: Examine patterns in prefixes and suffixes for verbs, adjectives and adverbs.

1804AA80110241799E722965B792545A.description: Comprehend a broader range of vocabulary in personal and public texts (e.g., 500 sight words).

C48464B655614EE195995BF375647FA2.description: Demonstrate, when interpreting oral and written texts, knowledge of German language concepts including context-specific vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

7ECD0A0A921C4A3897D2A056C830ACB0.description: Reflect, with some guidance, on personal writing or speaking process.

8DE0CD28F5BD4D048C0CCA063C13DD04.description: Discuss possible strategies to address challenges (e.g., tolerance of ambiguity and maintaining a positive attitude) of learning to communicate in an additional language.

51F9623B92884E54BA73D194942CD8CC.description: Maintain a journal to gain awareness of which language production strategies are most effective.

2670222710E34ABB9CA3F139FC8DE559.description: Evaluate personal written or oral production and provide suggestions for improvement.

43CAA4A722A041459C34B74755902B30.description: Apply, with some guidance, language learning strategies to support the production of written text, such as: taking risks; using prior knowledge and cognates for personal expression in German; and, spelling more difficult words using phonics and generalizations.

4D4B8A2A78474D2489893C5DE37E4101.description: Apply, with some guidance, oral communication and mediation strategies such as: taking risks; applying prior knowledge and cognates for personal expression in German; using physical and auditory cues (e.g., gestures, facial expressions, laughter, tone and volume) to convey meaning; and, repeating the main points of simple messages to clarify intent.

8A074865F25F49309122F108F362E3FB.description: Employ tools (e.g., charts, vocabulary lists and audio files) and consult resources (e.g., grammar references books and electronic applications) to support the production of oral and written texts.

27CB169658AE4067BD157C638D1ACD59.description: Develop a plan for speaking or writing by preparing notes, organizers and a timeline.

E879B16FA8014022AE190930506A0B8B.description: Apply, with some guidance, a variety of before, during and after strategies to communicate meaning when writing and speaking.

E27E69CD23E14F6299192A69F1D77316.description: Use the German language for personal communication and to interact with teachers and classmates.

73A48361E7B8477B994B5614C9861F14.description: Select and apply, with some guidance, a variety of strategies to produce oral and written texts in German and reflect on personal language learning.

B0BAB6F7CF5246F5AAB77594C2E7E966.description: Reflect, with some guidance, on personal viewing, listening and reading strategies.

D1D242F991BC484FB4F21A8D1F5EAA06.description: Discuss possible strategies to address challenges of learning to interpret an additional language.

019EA1286BA6451781885486B597EF96.description: Maintain a journal to gain awareness of which language learning strategies are most effective.

692C98287F5549BF9315F069610B3407.description: Employ knowledge of text structures (e.g., use topic sentences in paragraphs to make accurate inferences about the meaning of subsequent material) to interpret the message.

524E8960A5A64CEB8EA9D40B9666C8CE.description: Pose questions to clarify interpretation of texts.

778EC852DA774B9CB221C767BB0E8674.description: Apply, with some guidance, language learning strategies such as: using supplementary information (e.g., pre-discussion, subtitles and graphics); interpreting physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., tone, laughter and volume) cues; examining context clues and key words to infer meaning; using phonics and generalizations to decode individual and compound words; and, identifying cognates from English (e.g., kochen – Koch) or from another language (e.g., Eis – ice / ice cream) to decipher words.

6DDBDB465E714D569D3C2F0C9E71C4FA.description: Employ tools (e.g., charts, vocabulary lists and audio files) and consult resources (e.g., peers and family, grammar reference books and electronic applications) to help construct meaning of oral and written texts.

8B50F16E727844B89C426D7FFB013237.description: Prepare to interpret oral and written texts using language learning strategies such as developing predictions and inquiring about purpose and context.

91A4B60C8AAE459DA820F771216A9DB4.description: Apply, with some guidance, a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct meaning when listening, viewing and reading.

ABA9377405554909B5056B2B9B55E564.description: Select and apply, with some guidance, a variety of strategies to interpret oral and written texts in German and reflect on personal language learning.
